# PR Title

Use Conventional Commits in the title: <type>(<scope>): <summary>
Examples:
- feat(backend): add JWT refresh flow
- fix(frontend): resolve null crash on chat list
- chore(ci): add turbo remote cache

Scopes: backend | frontend | api-contracts | shared-config | fullstack | ci | repo

## Summary
- Why is this change needed?
- What problem does it solve or what value does it add?

## Changes
- High-level bullet list of changes

## Checklist
- [ ] Title follows Conventional Commits with scope
- [ ] Branch name follows GitFlow-Lite + Scoped Branches (e.g., feat/backend/xyz)
- [ ] Tests added/updated (unit/e2e) where applicable
- [ ] Documentation updated (README/docs) where applicable
- [ ] No secrets or sensitive data committed

## Linked Issues
- Closes #NNN

## Screenshots / Videos (if UI)
- N/A

## Notes for Reviewers
- Risks, trade-offs, or follow-ups
